TopicTitle: Friction seems to be a problem

Articles.Content: I haven't played for a long time, but on this playthrough I have noticed that friction seems strangely absent. Like anything on any planet thats even slightly tilted, when just slowly glide down. I can't be the only one who has noticed this, but has the devs said anything about?
Well known. Not scheduled to be resolved until KSP 1.2 as I understand it. Legs and wheels use some of the same bugged code.
Well as long as its on the fix list, thats something

I've even seen the opposite, where my lander slowly slides UP a hill. My guess is that the rotation of the body is causing it (likened to centrifugal force), but that's just a hunch. Someone would have to dig into the code to see what's happening.

Yup.  It's on the fix list.  Unfortunately it'll be a while, since the problem comes from Unity itself, and it requires an update to a newer Unity version to fix, which is a big undertaking and won't be happening in the 1.1.3 timescale.  This week's dev notes have a discussion about it:

As a player, the issues with wheels and legs are aggravating, sure, but there's not a lot Squad can do about it-- or, rather, what they can do about it, they're already doing.  It'll just take time.
